text:
The transect method is an ecological technique which permit the ecologists to numbered and named the species living on a large place.  It consists in looking for every subject of interest like pollinators, flowered plants, birds, etc.
  	To create a transect, the scientist should define the subject of his study (pollinators, for example) and the parameters he wants to test like the number of individuals, the amount of different species and the climatic conditions of the site. Then, he decides which place he wants to inventory and creates the path (straightest as possible) he will take.
 During the manipulation, the ecologist could take the information in two ways. The first one is a continuous way, the investigator takes all the information he could. Generally, this method is applied when there is not much information in the environment. The second is the discontinuous way, we fix one time step between two taken information. The technique is used when there is two much data in the site.
	This method is very efficient in ecology because it allows to see that the environment is complex and variable, so the experimenter could note every extra information he sees. Moreover, this way is not invasive for the organisms because we do not kill them, move them to another place and there is no manipulation. It also includes a low cost.
 However, the technique brings some issues. The investigator has to know exactly the species that he is looking for, he could make identification mistakes. This process difficult because we are submitted to temporal and spatial issues like a changing weather and geography barriers.
  	The transect method is a very useful technique used in ecology to inventory an environment but it has some drawbacks for the experimenter.
